name: NPR
text:
Protesters in Belarus' capital took to the streets in large numbers Sunday for the fifth weekend in a row, calling for the country's authoritarian president to resign. Demonstrations also took place in 16 other cities across the country.
https://t.co/MwLjENpGdk

name: NPR
text:
Book Review: Sophie Yanow's new graphic novel chronicles her time studying abroad in Paris. It's not suspenseful or eventful, but Yanow's combination of perception and humility makes for an engaging read.
https://t.co/TETfFMn7RX

name: NPR
text:
Actress Sarah Paulson says in writer-producer Ryan Murphy's world, "you better go big or go home." The duo takes a visit to an asylum together once again in "Ratched," which drops on Netflix this week. | @hereandnow 
https://t.co/VoacdgQu5M

name: NPR
text:
Latino USA host Maria Hinojosa has spent her career covering those silenced in the media. Now she's telling her own story in a new memoir.

"We all have to work at making the immigrant story much more public," she says.
https://t.co/AIjAEUmCqF

name: NPR
text:
"When the Light of the World Was Subdued, Our Songs Came Through" collects the work of more than 160 poets,  representing close to 100 indigenous nations. 

"A poem opens up time, it opens up memory, it opens up place," says Joy Harjo, U.S. Poet Laureate.
https://t.co/Ioo7np4rIN

name: NPR
text:
How do we help older people feel safe and comfortable â€” and happy â€” in these times?

â€¢ Write postcards every week
â€¢ Go for scenic drives
â€¢ Schedule virtual TV time
â€¢ Use family history as a topic for virtual lessons

See more ideas from our readers:
https://t.co/POohD3EXg5

name: NPR
text: The Army is working with private industry to create a coronavirus vaccine, but also working on its own. The military service has a history of creating vaccines and making medical breakthroughs. https://t.co/cIXbxPPigW

name: NPR
text:
With its deadline to sell or be banned in the U.S. fast-approaching, the Chinese tech giant ByteDance says it won't be selling TikTok to either Microsoft or Oracle, according to China state TV.
https://t.co/g0G0e1dLKa

name: NPR
text:
Dozens of states have modified their mail-in voting procedures for November's elections because of the pandemic.

We created a map so you can check the rules in yours ðŸ‘‡
https://t.co/y1aL6KOdCl

name: NPR
text:
A @houstonpubmedia reporter went to four different courthouses last week to observe about 100 eviction cases.

Only one renter was able to use the CDC's new ban to block their eviction.

So, in 99% of those cases, the order was having no effect at all.
https://t.co/rPW1mkR9hl

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: A professor who has spent his career questioning the basics of climate science and whose research has been supported by fossil fuel companies has been hired for a top position at the NOAA, the federal agency that oversees weather and climate forecasting. https://t.co/piq0osRTg0

name: NPR
text:
The Trump administration has undertaken more than 400 executive actions on immigration. Biden is pledging to dismantle them if he wins the presidency.

But immigration policy experts say accomplishing that in 4 years would be "a monumental challenge." https://t.co/Fbo880F8tP

name: NPR
text: In a wide-ranging interview about his new book "Rage," Bob Woodward told NPR that he believed the president was talâ€¦ https://t.co/q2NQNgWmtt

name: NPR
text:
Update: Hurricane Sally has formed off the U.S. coast of the Gulf of Mexico, after strengthening late Monday morning. 

Some coastal areas in Louisiana, Mississippi, Florida and Alabama are already seeing floods. https://t.co/A7pRDL9HHS

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: Are you confused about how to vote this year? Do you have questions about how to vote by mail or whether it's safe to vote in person? 

NPR wants to help: https://t.co/Xi7qcpg1Cd

name: NPR
text:
When some 20 million people tuned in to watch the start of the NFL season, Joe Biden's campaign was there with a minute-long campaign ad.

And that's only the beginning. Fans will continue getting a dose of presidential politics during commercial breaks.
https://t.co/5hOvKlqupv

name: NPR
text:
After the Parkland massacre, Florida passed a law requiring a police officer or armed guard at every school. The number of police on campus has nearly doubled since â€” and arrests at school are up 82%.

Now, there are calls to get rid of police in schools. https://t.co/EczwMUJxb7

name: NPR
text:
A little-known company creates a technology that uses vast amounts of data to profile voters and offers it to a party during a big election year. 

The year is 1960 â€” not 2016.

And that company is the subject of Harvard historian Jill Lepore's new book. https://t.co/yJo9hkYtSx
